description.narrative: Frontline health and community workers have improved capacity to provide flexible, integrated services for management of common childhood illnesses to young children in targeted emergency and non-emergency settings, which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children under five years and pregnant women use more equitable and better quality essential maternal, newborn and child health services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Frontline health and community workers have improved capacity to provide flexible, integrated services for management of common childhood illnesses to young children in targeted emergency and non-emergency settings

description.narrative: 4,038 health workers (35% above target) were trained in rapid malaria diagnostic testing in children. 1,148 community health workers (709 males; 439 females) were trained to implement integrated community case management (target 1,125). As of December 2019, 779,623 curative consultations with lifesaving treatment were provided to children under five years (110 per cent of the 708,570 target), mainly for malaria (35%), acute respiratory infections (20% and diarrheal diseases (16%). Nearly half (47 per cent or 46,732) of 100,000 families targeted for distribution of 2 long-lasting insecticide-treated nets (LLINs) per family were reached, thereby impacting malaria prevention efforts. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
